projects.title: Mega Market Mayhem
projects.shortDescription: A fast-paced multiplayer 1v1 fighting game where players compete to see who's on top with quirky and fun food based characters.
projects.fullDescription:
Mega Market Mayhem is an intense multiplayer fighting game that combines fast-paced combat with quirky food-themed characters in a chaotic supermarket setting. Players engage in 1v1 battles using unique food-based fighters, each with their own special abilities and combat styles.

Key Features:
• Multiplayer 1v1 fighting mechanics
• Unique food-based character roster
• Dynamic supermarket environments
• Special abilities and combo systems
• Chaotic and fun gameplay designed for competitive play

The game focuses on accessible yet deep fighting mechanics, making it easy for newcomers to jump in while providing enough complexity for competitive players to master.
projects.challenges: The biggest challenge was implementing smooth multiplayer networking and ensuring fair gameplay across different connection speeds.
projects.learnings: This project taught me a lot about multiplayer game architecture and the importance of responsive combat systems.

projects.title: Scriptorium
projects.shortDescription: An immersive narrative dungeon crawler where one must draw to attack, utilizing advanced neural model recognition.
projects.fullDescription:
Scriptorium is an innovative dungeon crawler that revolutionizes combat through drawing mechanics. Players must physically draw symbols and patterns to cast spells and perform attacks, using advanced neural network recognition to interpret their drawings in real-time.

Innovative Features:
• Neural network-powered drawing recognition
• Learn a unique 'language' of combat through drawing
• Immersive narrative-driven progression
• Roguelite elements with procedural dungeons
• Strategic spell combinations through drawing
• Rich storyline with multiple branching paths

The game combines traditional dungeon crawling with cutting-edge AI technology, creating a truly unique gameplay experience that feels both familiar and revolutionary.
projects.challenges: Integrating neural network recognition for drawing input while maintaining responsive gameplay was extremely challenging.
projects.learnings: This project expanded my knowledge of machine learning integration in games and real-time input processing.

projects.title: Mazetastic Colors
projects.shortDescription: A strategic yet multi-leveled fun maze game focused around matching colors and finding the exit!
projects.fullDescription:
Mazetastic Colors combines traditional maze navigation with color-based puzzle mechanics, creating a unique and challenging gameplay experience across multiple levels of increasing complexity.

Gameplay Features:
• Strategic maze navigation with color-matching mechanics
• Multiple levels with progressively complex layouts
• Color-based puzzle solving elements
• Strategic thinking required to find optimal paths
• Clean, accessible visual design
• Satisfying progression system

The game challenges players to think both spatially and strategically, combining pathfinding skills with color logic puzzles.
projects.challenges: Designing levels that balanced maze complexity with color puzzle difficulty without overwhelming players.
projects.learnings: This project taught me about puzzle design principles and creating intuitive yet challenging gameplay.

projects.title: Valentine Bash
projects.shortDescription: A strategic and fast based vertical shooter, kill the bugs trying to kill love and save valentine's day!
projects.fullDescription:
Valentine Bash is a fast-paced vertical shooter with a romantic twist! Players must defend love itself by eliminating waves of bugs that threaten to destroy Valentine's Day. The game combines classic arcade shooter mechanics with strategic elements and multi-camera rendering.

Game Features:
• Fast-paced vertical shooting action
• Strategic enemy patterns and wave design
• Multiple levels with increasing difficulty
• Multi-camera rendering system for dynamic perspectives
• Valentine's Day themed art and story
• Power-ups and weapon upgrades
• Score-based progression system

The game captures the intensity of classic arcade shooters while adding modern polish and strategic depth.
projects.challenges: Implementing smooth multi-camera rendering while maintaining consistent performance across different devices.
projects.learnings: This project improved my understanding of camera systems and performance optimization in Unity.

projects.title: Matching Memories
projects.shortDescription: A slow and simple matching game with diegetic UI and multiple levels!
projects.fullDescription:
Matching Memories is a thoughtfully designed matching game that emphasizes calm, meditative gameplay while incorporating innovative diegetic UI elements. The game focuses on creating a relaxing experience across multiple progressively challenging levels.

Design Philosophy:
• Slow-paced, relaxing gameplay that encourages mindfulness
• Diegetic UI that integrates seamlessly with the game world
• Multiple levels with carefully designed difficulty progression
• Clean, minimalist visual design
• Soothing audio design and feedback
• Accessibility-focused design principles

The game demonstrates how traditional matching mechanics can be elevated through thoughtful design and attention to user experience.
projects.challenges: Creating diegetic UI elements that felt natural and intuitive while maintaining game functionality.
projects.learnings: This project taught me about UI/UX design principles and the importance of accessibility in game design.

projects.title: Fishing For Fun
projects.shortDescription: A fun arcade style shooter-looter, use your harpoon to swing around the level collecting fish and upgrading your stats!
projects.fullDescription:
Fishing For Fun combines arcade shooting mechanics with looter progression systems, creating a unique experience where players use a harpoon both as a weapon and a traversal tool. The game focuses on fluid movement and satisfying collection mechanics.

Core Mechanics:
• Harpoon-based movement and combat system
• Arcade-style shooting with physics-based projectiles
• Loot collection and character progression
• Swinging mechanics for dynamic traversal
• Stat upgrades and equipment systems
• Multiple level environments with different challenges
• High-score based arcade progression

The game successfully merges several genres to create something that feels both familiar and fresh.
projects.challenges: Creating responsive harpoon physics that felt good for both movement and combat.
projects.learnings: This project improved my understanding of physics-based gameplay and arcade game design principles.

projects.title: Bender Man
projects.shortDescription: A silly collecting game parodying the Slender Man series, collect the pages before he gets you!
projects.fullDescription:
Bender Man is a humorous parody of the classic Slender Man horror games, turning the terrifying concept into a lighthearted collecting adventure. Players must gather scattered pages while avoiding the comically reimagined antagonist.

Parody Elements:
• Playful take on classic horror game mechanics
• Collecting gameplay with a twist of humor
• 3D environments that both honor and subvert the original
• Survival mechanics with comedic timing
• Easter eggs and references to the original series
• Accessible horror that's more fun than frightening

The game demonstrates how familiar mechanics can be transformed through tone and presentation to create entirely different experiences.
projects.challenges: Balancing parody elements with actual engaging gameplay mechanics.
projects.learnings: This project taught me about tone and how presentation can completely change a player's experience.

projects.title: Navi
projects.shortDescription: A fast-paced singleplayer narrative platformer, play as a lost rabbit fighting to get home through the forest.
projects.fullDescription:
Navi tells the emotional story of a lost rabbit navigating through a mysterious forest where nothing is quite what it seems. This narrative-driven platformer combines precise movement mechanics with time-based puzzles and a compelling storyline.

Story & Gameplay:
• Play as Navi, a determined rabbit on a journey home
• Navigate through beautifully crafted forest environments
• Uncover the mysteries hidden within the forest
• Master time-based mechanics that affect the world around you
• Experience multiple story revelations and plot twists
• Fast-paced platforming with precision controls

The game explores themes of perseverance, home, and the unexpected challenges we face on our journeys through life.
projects.challenges: Creating smooth time-based mechanics that felt intuitive while maintaining the narrative pacing was quite complex.
projects.learnings: This project taught me about environmental storytelling and how gameplay mechanics can enhance narrative themes.

projects.title: Casino Game!
projects.shortDescription: A silly and simple casino game coded in pure C++ with text based inputs!
projects.fullDescription:
A fun academic project that recreates the excitement of casino games through pure C++ programming with text-based interfaces. This project demonstrates fundamental programming concepts while creating an entertaining gambling simulation.

Features:
• Multiple casino games (slots, blackjack, poker)
• Text-based user interface
• Random number generation systems
• Player statistics and money management
• Save/load game functionality
• Betting systems and odds calculation

Built entirely in C++ without external libraries, this project showcases core programming skills and game logic implementation.
projects.challenges: Implementing fair random number generation and managing complex game state without external libraries.
projects.learnings: This project strengthened my understanding of C++ fundamentals and probability systems in games.

projects.title: OpenGL Environments
projects.shortDescription: Scenes and textures coded in C++ and OpenGL.
projects.fullDescription:
A collection of 3D scenes and environments built from scratch using C++ and OpenGL, demonstrating low-level graphics programming and mathematical concepts in computer graphics.

Technical Achievements:
• Custom 3D rendering pipeline
• Texture mapping and lighting systems
• Shader programming (vertex and fragment)
• Mathematical transformations and camera systems
• Real-time rendering optimizations
• Multiple scene compositions with different themes

These projects showcase the fundamentals of computer graphics programming and the mathematical principles that power modern game engines.
projects.challenges: Understanding the mathematical foundations of 3D graphics and implementing efficient rendering pipelines.
projects.learnings: This project gave me deep insight into how modern graphics engines work under the hood.

projects.title: Scrum Facilitation
projects.shortDescription: The various tools I've created, researched, and implemented into team use to more easily facilitate the agile / scrum workflow.
projects.fullDescription:
A comprehensive collection of tools, processes, and implementations designed to streamline agile and scrum workflows in game development teams. This project represents ongoing research and practical application of project management methodologies.

Tools & Implementations:
• Custom sprint planning and tracking tools
• Automated burndown chart generation
• Team velocity analysis systems
• Retrospective facilitation frameworks
• Integration tools for development workflows
• Documentation and training materials
• Performance metrics and reporting systems

These tools have been tested and refined through real-world team implementations, focusing on practical solutions that actually improve team productivity.
projects.challenges: Balancing tool complexity with ease of use, and getting team buy-in for new processes.
projects.learnings: This project deepened my understanding of team dynamics and the practical challenges of implementing agile methodologies.

projects.title: Project Documentation
projects.shortDescription: Various examples of documentation I've created as a game designer and programmer, as well as more historically focused deconstructions.
projects.fullDescription:
A comprehensive portfolio of technical and design documentation spanning game development, programming practices, and historical game analysis. This collection showcases my ability to communicate complex technical concepts clearly and thoroughly.

Documentation Types:
• Technical design documents for game systems
• Code documentation and API references
• Game design documents with detailed mechanics
• Historical game deconstructions and analysis
• Development process documentation
• Team workflow and standards documentation
• Post-mortem analyses of completed projects

These documents demonstrate both technical writing skills and deep understanding of game development processes across different eras and platforms.
projects.challenges: Making technical documentation accessible to both technical and non-technical team members.
projects.learnings: This work has improved my communication skills and understanding of historical game development practices.
